cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.originalText: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You get another combat phase, followed by another main phase, this turn.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures.)
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.
cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

cards.flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.
cards.name: Barbtooth Wurm

cards.flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has an island in play.)
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ." —The Bible, Mark 5:13
cards.name: Durkwood Boars

cards.flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.
cards.name: Gorilla Warrior

cards.flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.
cards.name: Grizzly Bears
Lone Wolf
cards.originalText: Lone Wolf may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.
cards.name: Lynx
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.
cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream
cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.
cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.originalText: You gain 8 life.
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.name: Nature's Cloak
cards.originalText: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They're unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)
cards.text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.
cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"‘Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout
cards.name: Norwood Archers
cards.originalText: Norwood Archers can block as though it had flying.
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

cards.flavor: Death just encourages life the more.
cards.name: Renewing Touch
cards.originalText: Shuffle any number of creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.
cards.name: Silverback Ape

cards.flavor: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.
cards.name: Southern Elephant

cards.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam
cards.name: Squall

cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.
cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.originalText: Put up to three land cards from your hand into play.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.originalText: When Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. Sylvan Basilisk still doesn't deal damage to defending player.)
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

cards.flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

cards.originalText: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
